data.name: prySerenity
data.value: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can and the wisdom to know the difference.

data.name: txtSerenityPrayer
data.value: Serenity Prayer

data.name: pryStep10Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, I pray I may continue: To grow in understanding and effectiveness; To take daily spot check inventories of myself; To correct mistakes when I make them; To take responsibility for my actions; To be ever aware of my negative and self-defeating attitudes and behaviors; To keep my willfulness in check; To always remember I need Your help; To keep love and tolerance of others as my code; And to continue in daily prayer how I can best serve You, My Higher Power.

data.name: pryStep11Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, I pray to keep my connection with You open and clear from the confusion of daily life. Through my prayers and meditation I ask especially for freedom from self-will, rationalization, and wishful thinking. I pray for the guidance of correct thought and positive action. Your will, Higher Power, not mine, be done.

data.name: pryStep12Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, my spiritual awakening continues to unfold. The help I have received I shall pass on and give to others, both in and out of the Fellowship. For this opportunity I am grateful. I pray most humbly to continue walking day by day on the road of spiritual progress. I pray for the inner strength and wisdom to practice the principles of this way of life in all I do and say. I need You, my friends, and the program every hour of every day. This is a better way to live.

data.name: pryStep1Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, my name is ____. I'm a real alcoholic... and I need your help today.

data.name: pryStep2Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, I'm standing at the turning point right now. Give me your protection and care as I abandon myself to you and give up my old ways and my old ideas just for today.

data.name: pryStep3Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, I offer myself to Thee to build with me and to do with me as Thou wilt. Relieve me of the bondage of self, that I may better do Thy will. Take away my difficulties, that victory over them may bear witness to those I would help of Thy Power, Thy Love, and Thy Way of life. May I do Thy will always.

data.name: pryStep4Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, It is I who has made my life a mess. I have done it, but I cannot undo it. My mistakes are mine and I will begin a searching and fearless moral inventory. I will write down my wrongs but I will also include that which is good. I pray for the strength to complete the task.

data.name: pryStep5Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, My inventory has shown me who I am, Yet I ask for Your help in admitting my wrongs to another person and to You. Assure me, and be with me, in this step, for without this Step I cannot progress in my recovery. With Your help, I can do this, and I do it.

data.name: pryStep6Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, I am ready for Your help in removing from me the defects of character which I now realize are an obstacle to my recovery. Help me to continue being honest with myself and guide me toward spiritual and mental health.

data.name: pryStep7Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, I am now willing that you should have all of me, good and bad. I pray that you now remove from me every single defect of character which stands in the way of my usefulness to you and my fellows. Grant me strength, as I go out from here to do your bidding.

data.name: pryStep8Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, I ask Your help in making my list of all those I have harmed. I will take responsibility for my mistakes and be forgiving to others as You are forgiving to me. Grant me the willingness to begin my restitution. This I pray.

data.name: pryStep9Prayer
data.value: Dear Higher Power, I pray for the right attitude to make my amends, being ever mindful not to harm others in the process. I ask for Your guidance in making indirect amends. Most important, I will continue to make amends by staying abstinent, helping others and growing in spiritual progress.

data.name: txtStep9
data.value: Step 9

data.name: txtStep10Content
data.value: Continued to take personal inventory and when we were wrong promptly admitted it.

data.name: txtStep11Content
data.value: Sought through prayer and meditation to improve our conscious contact with God, as we understood Him, praying only for knowledge of His will for us and the power to carry that out.

data.name: txtStep12Content
data.value: Having had a spiritual awakening as the result of these Steps, we tried to carry this message to other alcoholics, and to practice these principles in all our affairs.

data.name: txtStep1Content
data.value: We admitted we were powerless over alcohol - that our lives had become unmanageable.

data.name: txtStep2Content
data.value: Came to believe that a Power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity.

data.name: txtStep3Content
data.value: Made a decision to turn our will and our lives over to the care of God as we understood Him.

data.name: txtStep4Content
data.value: Made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.

data.name: txtStep5Content
data.value: Admitted to God, to ourselves and to another human being the exact nature of our wrongs.

data.name: txtStep6Content
data.value: Were entirely ready to have God remove all these defects of character.

data.name: txtStep7Content
data.value: Humbly asked Him to remove our shortcomings.

data.name: txtStep8Content
data.value: Made a list of all persons we had harmed, and became willing to make amends to them all.

data.name: txtStep9Content
data.value: Made direct amends to such people wherever possible, except when to do so would injure them or others.

data.name: txtTradition1
data.value: Tradition 1

data.name: txtTradition10
data.value: Tradition 10

data.name: txtTradition10Content
data.value: Alcoholics Anonymous has no opinion on outside issues; hence the A.A. name ought never be drawn into public controversy.

data.name: txtTradition11
data.value: Tradition 11

data.name: txtTradition11Content
data.value: Our public relations policy is based on attraction rather than promotion; we need always maintain personal anonymity at the level of press, radio, and films.

data.name: txtTradition12
data.value: Tradition 12

data.name: txtTradition12Content
data.value: Anonymity is the spiritual foundation of all our Traditions, ever reminding us to place principles before personalities.

data.name: txtTradition1Content
data.value: Our common welfare should come first; personal recovery depends upon A.A. unity.

data.name: txtTradition2
data.value: Tradition 2

data.name: txtTradition2Content
data.value: For our group purpose there is but one ultimate authority—a loving God as He may express Himself in our group conscience. Our leaders are but trusted servants; they do not govern.

data.name: txtTradition3
data.value: Tradition 3

data.name: txtTradition3Content
data.value: The only requirement for A.A. membership is a desire to stop drinking.

data.name: txtTradition4
data.value: Tradition 4

data.name: txtTradition4Content
data.value: Each group should be autonomous except in matters affecting other groups or A.A. as a whole.

data.name: txtTradition5
data.value: Tradition 5

data.name: txtTradition5Content
data.value: Each group has but one primary purpose—to carry its message to the alcoholic who still suffers.

data.name: txtTradition6
data.value: Tradition 6

data.name: txtTradition6Content
data.value: An A.A. group ought never endorse, finance, or lend the A.A. name to any related facility or outside enterprise, lest problems of money, property, and prestige divert us from our primary purpose.

data.name: txtTradition7
data.value: Tradition 7

data.name: txtTradition7Content
data.value: Every A.A. group ought to be fully self-supporting, declining outside contributions.

data.name: txtTradition8
data.value: Tradition 8

data.name: txtTradition8Content
data.value: Alcoholics Anonymous should remain forever nonprofessional, but our service centers may employ special workers.

data.name: txtTradition9
data.value: Tradition 9

data.name: txtTradition9Content
data.value: A.A., as such, ought never be organized; but we may create service boards or committees directly responsible to those they serve.

data.name: txtIfTheAppIsNotLaunched
data.value: If the application is not launched for 2 weeks, the Live Tile will stop updating. This is a Windows Phone OS restriction. You must re-launch, re-select your date from 'Days Since' and re-select the 'Show on Live Tile' checkbox again.

data.name: txtInfoInThisAppNotCollected
data.value: Information in this application is not collected or distributed and is meant only for your viewing pleasure.

data.name: txtLiveTileGetsUpdated
data.value: The Live Tile gets updated every half hour after power-up. So if the 'Days Since' count is off, wait half an hour for it to update correctly.
